physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Serum calcium level of 12.2 mg/dl (normal range 8.8–10.2 mg/dl) and intact PTH level of 206 pg/ml (normal range 10–65 pg/ml) at diagnosis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At age 42, serum calcium was 10.8 mg/dl and intact PTH was 105.2 pg/ml. Following parathyroidectomy at this age, levels remained high suggesting further investigation for ectopic tissue.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Post-surgical levels of calcium and intact PTH remained elevated, indicating a sixth parathyroid gland.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Post-resection, serum calcium dropped to 8.9 mg/dl and intact PTH to 10 pg/ml, indicating successful removal of the ectopic gland.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient has been euparathyroid with normal serum levels post-resection.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement noted with normal levels of calcium and intact PTH after the ectopic gland was resected.
